summary: This is an email chain from March 14, 2020, discussing a Telegraph article about Prince Andrew's reported cooperation with Jeffrey Epstein investigators. A U.S. Attorney's Office public information officer expresses frustration about being misquoted and clarifies that their office contacted Andrew's lawyers, who stated there would be no interview, contradicting the article's implication of ongoing negotiations.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The central subject of the Telegraph article being discussed; his reported cooperation with Epstein investigators is the topic. His lawyers are stated to have communicated with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The investigation into which Prince Andrew is reportedly cooperating, as per the article being discussed.

connections.description: The email discusses an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, with Prince Andrew being a subject of interest regarding cooperation with that investigation.

events.title: Publication of Page Six/Telegraph article
events.description: An article is published reporting that Prince Andrew is now cooperating with Jeffrey Epstein investigators.

events.title: Email discussion about misquotation
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office public information officer complains in an email that a Telegraph reporter misquoted them, incorrectly portraying communication with Prince Andrew's lawyers as ongoing negotiations rather than a simple refusal.

keyFacts: A U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) public information officer states their office contacted Prince Andrew's lawyers regarding an interview.
Prince Andrew's lawyers responded to the U.S. Attorney's Office that there would be no interview, contradicting media reports of cooperation or ongoing dialogue.
The public information officer expresses significant frustration with a British tabloid (The Telegraph) for misrepresenting their statements about the communication with Andrew's legal team.
The email chain is a reaction to a March 13, 2020, Page Six article citing a Telegraph report about Prince Andrew's cooperation with Epstein investigators.
